title.romaji: Maou Gakuin no Futekigousha: Shijou Saikyou no Maou no Shiso, Tensei shite Shison-tachi no Gakkou e Kayou II Part 2
title.english: The Misfit of Demon King Academy II (Cour 2)

description:
The second cour of the second season of Maou Gakuin no Futekigousha.

The academy's lessons are back in session with Anos Voldigoad fighting more powerful enemies!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: The Misfit of Demon King Academy: History’s Strongest Demon King Reincarnates and Goes to School with His Descendants Season 2 Part 2
ใครว่าข้าไม่เหมาะเป็นจอมมาร: ต้นตระกูลจอมมารที่เเกร่งที่สุดในประวัติศาสตร์เกิดใหม่ไปเรียนที่โรงเรียนลูกหลาน ภาค 2 Part 2

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
__[Website](http://burnoutsyndromes.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/burnout_live) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXos4VWtLz_TNjLZy6F8mdw)__

__Introduction:__
BURNOUT SYNDROMES is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label EPIC Records Japan (2016–), affiliated with the entertainment agency Handmade Music. 

__Biography:__
The band initially formed in 2005, due to Taiyu being heavily influenced by his brother to start a band. He would first invite Kazuumi, who went to the same school as Taiyu, then he invited Takuya, who was an avid player of drum mania at the local game center. This trio would eventually become the BURNOUT SYNDROMES as we know today.

__Members:__
- [Kazuumi Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/149247) (熊谷和海) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics and composition
- Taiyu Ishikawa (石川大裕) – bassist, chorus, M&C
- Takuya Hirose (廣瀬拓哉) – drummer, chorus

__Height:__ 152 cm
__Agency:__ Intention 

[Artist Profile](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Profile/A023615.html) | [Official Site](http://toyamanao.com/) | [Official Club](http://fc.toyamanao.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/toyamanao/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/naobou_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/naobou_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/naobou_channel) | [Wiki (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nao_T%C5%8Dyama) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%B1%E5%B1%B1%E5%A5%88%E5%A4%AE)

__Radio Programs:__
- (2014-2017) Touyama Nao's Dream * Theater
- (2017-) Touyama Nao's Radio @ Living

__Awards:__ 
- (2019-03-09) Best Supporting Actress Award at the 13th Annual Seiyuu Awards
- (2019-03-09) Game Award at the 13th Annual Seiyuu Awards

__Early Life & Education__
She was born in Tokyo on March 11, 1992. Her father had spent 9 years abroad and was fluent in English, which allowed her to develop fluency in the language. From an early age she had an interest in anime, in particular the series _Ojamajo Doremi_ and _Sailor Moon_. However, it was the anime series _Fullmetal Alchemist_ that was the first to inspire her to become a voice actress. At the time, she was impressed that the series' protagonist Edward Elric was voiced by a female actress, [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/Romi-Park).

In junior high school and high school, she became part of a chorus club to help her overcome her tone deafness. It was also during this time she decided to pursue a voice acting career as she had interacted with schoolmates who had similar interests. Her parents approved of her decision, provided that she pass her university entrance exams. 

__Voice Acting Career__
While in high school, she began attending the Japan Narration Acting Institute. After 3 years of training, she passed her audition and joined the agency Arts Vision. At the same time, she also passed her entrance exam and began studying at Waseda University. She debuted as a voice actress in 2010 and later that year she played her first main role in the anime series _The World God Only Knows_. Throughout her 4 years in University, she continued to work as a voice actress, successfully managing both her work and school responsibilities. She graduated in March 2014 and left Art Vision shortly after on April 1. On May 1, 2014, she transferred to the agency Intention and is currently affiliated with them today.

__Music Career__
Her music career began when she released songs for _The World God Only Knows_ under her character name Kanon Nakagawa. In 2013, she became part of the music group Rhodanthe*, which performed theme songs for the _Kiniro Mosaic_ series. After having been cast in 2015, she has also released singles as her Idolmaster character Mizuki Kawashima. In 2016, she voiced a member of the in-universe music group Walküre, which performed songs for the anime series _Macross Δ_.

In 2017, she made her solo debut as a singer on February 1 with the release of her single "True Destiny" / "Chain the World" under the Flying Dog label. Later that year, her second single "Ima Koko" / "Tsuki ga Kirei" was released on May 24 as well as her first album _Rainbow_ on October 25. In 2018, she held her first solo live event at the Nippon Budokan on February 3 and released her third single "Tomoshibi no Manima ni" on May 30. In 2019, she released her second album _Gunjou Infinity_ on April 3. During the months of August and September, she held her first tour live event performing in the cities of Osaka, Nagoya, and Yokohama as well as cities outside of Japan like Taipei and Shanghai. In 2020, her fourth single "Aruite Ikou!" is set to release on February 5.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Misono Mika in "Blue Archive" (VG)
- Mualani in "Genshin Impact" (VG)
- Juna Crawford - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

__Nickname:__ Kuma-san (くまさん) __Favorite Artists:__ [BUMP OF CHICKEN](https://anilist.co/staff/109225/Bump-Of-Chicken), [ASIAN KUNG-FU GENERATION](https://anilist.co/staff/100251/Asian-KungFu-Generation) __Favorite Song:__ [Kyou made Soshite Ashita kara](https://anidb.net/song/54538) from [Crayon Shin-chan: Arashi o Yobu Mouretsu! Otona Teikoku Gyakushuu](https://anilist.co/anime/2450/Crayon-Shinchan-Movie-09-Arashi-wo-Yobu-Mouretsu-Otona-Teikoku-no-Gyakushuu/), released in 2001. __ Favorite Color:__ Red __Favorite Hobbies:__ Manga, Games __Introduction:__ Kazuumi Kumagai is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger, guitarist and member of the band Burnout Syndromes. __Biography:__ When he was in the first year of junior high school, he was invited to play in a band. He accepted the offer and started listening to music, writing lyrics and composing music. After joining the band he was told to play the guitar by band member [Ishikawa Taiyu](https://twitter.com/BURNOUTSYNDROME), which led him take on the guitar and be in charge of vocals in the band. On May 4, 2005 the pair Kazuumi and Taiyu decided they needed another member, so Taiyu invited [Hirose Takuya](https://twitter.com/hirose_burnout) to be the final member of the line-up for the rock-band BURNOUT SYNDROMES. Hirose at the time had been immersed at the local game center playing "DrumMania", so he saw this as an opportunity and accepted the offer from Taiyu. After this they proceeded to officially form the band on the same date. In 2010, they temporarily suspended band activities to focus on taking exams. Kazuumi alongside Taiyu and Takuya made their initial major debut as BURNOUT SYNDROMES with the song "[FLY HIGH!!](https://anidb.net/song/84120)", which was used as the second opening theme to the [Mitsunaka Susumu](https://anilist.co/staff/113823/Susumu-Mitsunaka) directed second season of the anime _[Haikyuu!!](https://anilist.co/anime/20992/Haikyuu-2/) 2_, otherwise known as _HAIKYU!! 2nd Season_. __Trivia:__ - He can't see his face because of his bangs. - Mentions that he usually sleeps during holidays (Source: [Wikipedia (Kazuumi Kumagai)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%86%8A%E8%B0%B7%E5%92%8C%E6%B5%B7), edited | [Wikipedia (BURNOUT SYNDROMES)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BURNOUT_SYNDROMES), edited)

Kazuumi alongside Taiyu and Takuya made their initial major debut as BURNOUT SYNDROMES with the song "[FLY HIGH!!](https://anidb.net/song/84120)", which was used as the second opening theme to the [Mitsunaka Susumu](https://anilist.co/staff/113823/Susumu-Mitsunaka) directed second season of the anime _[Haikyuu!!](https://anilist.co/anime/20992/Haikyuu-2/) 2_, otherwise known as _HAIKYU!! 2nd Season_. __Trivia:__ - He can't see his face because of his bangs. - Mentions that he usually sleeps during holidays (Source: [Wikipedia (Kazuumi Kumagai)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%86%8A%E8%B0%B7%E5%92%8C%E6%B5%B7), edited | [Wikipedia (BURNOUT SYNDROMES)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BURNOUT_SYNDROMES), edited)

orn and raised in New York, Seiji started his career working as a producer, songwriter and engineer in New York. In 1996 he debuted as an artist as a member of the group Bluesette, released on BMG Fun House Records. He is currently based in Tokyo, and has worked with a wide variety of artists there.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yukikishida) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuki_kishida) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7MhWrfW2HH8_umBaVNbUGw)__

__Yuuki Kishida__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, pianist and keyboardist affiliated with Kick Up Studio.

**Height:** 155 cm (5'1")

**[Website](https://www.kusunokitomori.com/) | [Profile (SMA)](https://www.sma.co.jp/s/sma/artist/441?ima=0000#/news/0) | [Profile (SMA VOICE)](http://smavoice.jp/s/sma03/artist/45?ima=5736) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomori_kusunoki)**

A Japanese voice actress who is currently affiliated with the Sony Music Artists agency. She made her voice acting debut in 2017, and in the same year she was cast in her first main role as Kirara, the heroine of the Japanese mobile game _Kirara Fantasia_. 

In September 2022, [Tomori announced her diagnosis with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (EDS) affecting her joints](https://www.kusunokitomori.com/info/archive/?id=546582), which limits her ability to engage in physically demanding activities such as dancing. [It was announced on Love Live!’s website at the same time](https://www.lovelive-anime.jp/news/01_1248.html) that she would be graduating from the role of [Setsuna Yuuki](https://anilist.co/character/132796/Yuki-Setsuna) in March 2023, with [Coco Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/124857) replacing her in the role.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- [Vice](https://anilist.co/character/277198) - Alchemy Stars (VG)
- [Kanade Yoisaki](https://anilist.co/character/249636) - Project Sekai: Colorful Stage! feat. Hatsune Miku (VG)
- Viper - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Seattle](https://anilist.co/character/197197), [I-58](https://anilist.co/character/228624), Glasgow - Azur Lane (VG)
- [Aunn Komano](https://anilist.co/character/145527) - Touhou Cannonball (VG)
- Vanessa - Cytus II (VG)
- [Ruka Kayamori](https://anilist.co/character/321897) - Heaven Burns Red (VG)
- [Firefly](https://anilist.co/character/349493) - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)

__Birthplace:__ Hikone, Shiga, Japan

[Website](https://www.tetsuya.uk.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tetsuya_official/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxQ5KMi8t1gxTIsezag3DA)

Tetsuya is a Japanese musician, best known as the leader and bassist of the rock band [L'Arc-en-Ciel](https://anilist.co/staff/100252/). Formerly known by the stage name tetsu, on December 1, 2009 he started to use his birth name. While in L'Arc-en-Ciel his name is stylized as tetsuya, whereas in his solo work it is stylized as TETSUYA.

(Source: Wikipedia)

**Height:** 155 cm (5'1")

**[Website](https://www.kusunokitomori.com/) | [Profile (SMA)](https://www.sma.co.jp/s/sma/artist/441?ima=0000#/news/0) | [Profile (SMA VOICE)](http://smavoice.jp/s/sma03/artist/45?ima=5736) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomori_kusunoki)**

A Japanese voice actress who is currently affiliated with the Sony Music Artists agency. She made her voice acting debut in 2017, and in the same year she was cast in her first main role as Kirara, the heroine of the Japanese mobile game _Kirara Fantasia_. 

In September 2022, [Tomori announced her diagnosis with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (EDS) affecting her joints](https://www.kusunokitomori.com/info/archive/?id=546582), which limits her ability to engage in physically demanding activities such as dancing. [It was announced on Love Live!’s website at the same time](https://www.lovelive-anime.jp/news/01_1248.html) that she would be graduating from the role of [Setsuna Yuuki](https://anilist.co/character/132796/Yuki-Setsuna) in March 2023, with [Coco Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/124857) replacing her in the role.

**Non-Anime Roles:**

- [Kanade Yoisaki](https://anilist.co/character/249636) - Project Sekai: Colorful Stage! feat. Hatsune Miku (VG)
- Viper - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Seattle](https://anilist.co/character/197197), [I-58](https://anilist.co/character/228624), Glasgow - Azur Lane (VG)

[Website](https://www.tetsuya.uk.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tetsuya_official/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxQ5KMi8t1gxTIsezag3DA)

Tetsuya is a Japanese musician, best known as the leader and bassist of the rock band [L'Arc-en-Ciel](https://anilist.co/staff/100252/). Formerly known by the stage name tetsu, on December 1, 2009 he started to use his birth name. While in L'Arc-en-Ciel his name is stylized as tetsuya, whereas in his solo work it is stylized as TETSUYA.

(Source: Wikipedia)

A Brazilian voice actor, dubbing director and announcer. He is recognized for his work in various series and anime, Future Trunks in Dragon Ball, Mu of Aries in Knights of the Zodiac, Yugi in Yu-Gi-Oh! and Edward Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist, for which the latter two won the Yamato Award for Best Voice Actor for a Protagonist in 2003 and 2006, respectively.
